Figures: Time series plots of daily maximums and daily means of cyanobacteria abundance (cells/mL) of the waterbodies.

```{r ggplot, fig.width=10, fig.height=5, echo=FALSE}

# test: i <- "Odell Lake_01147159"

for(i in gnisidname) {
  
  plot <- ggplot(subset(dta, dta$GNISIDNAME == i),
                 aes(x=as.Date(Date), 
                     y=`Cyanobacteria (cells/mL)`,
                     group=`Summary Statistics`,
                     color=`Summary Statistics`)) +
    geom_line(size=1.5) +
    geom_point(color="black", alpha=0.3, size=3) +
    xlab("Date") +
    scale_x_date(date_labels = "%b-%d",
                 date_breaks = "week") +
    ylab("Cyanobacteria (cells/mL)") +
    #scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +
    scale_y_continuous(trans = log10_trans(),
                       breaks = trans_breaks("log10", function(x) 10^x),
                       labels = trans_format("log10", math_format(10^.x))) +
    geom_hline(yintercept=100000,linetype="dashed",color="red",size=1.5) +
    annotate("text", as.Date(min(dta2$Date)), 100000, vjust = 1, hjust = 0,  label = "WHO Guideline") +
    ggtitle(i) +
    theme_bw() +
    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, vjust = 0.5, size = 10),
          axis.text.y = element_text(size = 10),
          axis.title.x = element_text(size = 12),
          axis.title.y = element_text(size = 12),
          plot.title = element_text(size=15))
  
  print(plot)
  
}

```
